info.title: Reply API Documentation
info.description: Our API uses the following endpoint: api.reply.io. There are two versions of the API - V1 and V2 that cover different functionality of the system. You can use both versions simultaneously. # Authentication To access the API, you need the API key located under Settings - API Key. Example of the API key: AKp2BbuyfS-ugPMkBmd3sg2 All API request URLs start with https://api.reply.io/v1/ or https://api.reply.io/v2/. For example, to make a request to get the list of contacts in your account, you need to append the people index path to the base URL to form a URL that looks like https://api.reply.io/v1/people. GET https://api.reply.io/v1/people?apiKey=AKp2BbuyfS-ugPMkBmd3sg2 curl https://api.reply.io/v1/people -H 'X-Api-Key: AKp2BbuyfS-ugPMkBmd3sg2' # Response Codes - 200 Request was successful. - 201 Item was successfully created. The Location header returned contains the URL to the newly-created item. - 400 Wrong input parameter. See the response content for details. - 401 User not found. No user was found for the granted ApiKey. - 403 Access denied. User with granted ApiKey doesn't have access to the requested resource. - 404 The requested resource could not be found. See the response content for details. - 500 Internal Server Error. See the response content for additional details. We are notified about any server errors and will resolve them shortly.

get.description:
Note:

The name value should be encoded to prevent problems with spaces inside the campaign name. For example: Campaign One should be encoded to ...?name=Campaign+One.

Response data type
  • id. integer, campaign id
  • created. DateTime, campaign creation date
  • name. string, campaign name
  • emailAccount. string, email account for sending emails in this campaign
  • ownerEmail. string, user account email of Campaign owner
  • deliveriesCount. integer, number of sent emails
  • opensCount. integer, number of opened emails
  • repliesCount. integer, number of replies
  • bouncesCount. integer, number of bounces
  • optOutsCount. integer, number of opt-outs
  • outOfOfficeCount. integer, number of out-of-offices
  • peopleCount. integer, number of contacts in campaign
  • peopleFinished. integer, number of finished contacts
  • peopleActive. integer, number of active contacts
  • peoplePaused. integer, number of paused contacts

GET v2/schedules returns the list of all schedules (Default + Created) in the user account. Note
  • if Team Edition is Turned ON (Public/Private), then the list of all schedules from all team accounts will be returned.
  • Bare in mind that default schedules are personal and are tied to the user account, so performing this request using api keys of different team members may bring different resuts.

get.summary: Get List of Campaign Schedules (Default only)
get.description:
GET v2/schedules returns one default schedule of the user account. Note
  • if Team Edition is Turned ON (Public/Private), then only one default schedule will be returned since it is tied to the user account.

get.summary: Get List of Contacts per Campaign
get.description:
GET /campaigns/{{campaignId}}/people

return a list of contacts by campaign Id. Response data type
  • people. array, array of people
    • id. integer, contact's id
    • email. string, contact's email
    • firstName. string, contact's first name
    • lastName. string, contact's last name
    • company. string, contact's company
    • city. string, contact's city
    • state. string, contact's state
    • country. string, contact's country
    • timeZoneId. string, contact's current timezone
    • title. string, contact's title
    • notes. string, notes about contact
    • phone. integer, contact's phone number
    • phoneStatus. string, contact's phone validation status
    • linkedInProfile. string, contact's LinkedIn url
    • companySize. integer, contact's current company size
    • industry. string, contact's current company industry
    • salesNavigatorUrl. string, contact's Sales Navigator url
    • linkedInRecruiterUrl. string, contact's LinkedIn Recruiter url
    • addingDate. date and time, date contact was added
    • customFields key. string, contact's custom field name
    • customFields value. string or integer, contact's custom field value
  • total. integer, total people count
  • page. integer, current page
  • limit. integer, page size. Default value is 100
  • pagesCount. integer, total number of pages with current limit
  • next. string, link for next page with current limit
  • previous. string, link to previous page with current limit

post.description:
POST v2/campaigns creates a new campaign in your Reply account.

The *Settings* section of the request body can be omitted. In this case the system loads the default settings. The *EmailAccount* parameter can be omitted. In this case the system chooses then the default email account (if there is one). Request data type
  • name. string, campaign name, required
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to, required
  • EmailsCountPerDay. integer, max number of emails a day sent, required
  • daysToFinishProspect. integer, number of days when the prospect finishes, required
  • emailSendingDelaySeconds. integer, delay between sending emails in seconds, required
  • dailyThrottling. integer, number of prospects that will be processed by the sequence over the given 24-hour period, required
  • disableOpensTracking. boolean, disable email open tracking, required
  • repliesHandlingType. string/enum, maximum length 25 symbols, required. Possible values: Mark person as finished, Continue sending emails
  • enableLinksTracking. boolean, enable link open tracking, required
  • number. integer, step number, required
  • inMinutesCount. integer, must be greater than or equal to '0' for the first step, must be greater than '1' for the second and subsequent steps, required
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects, required
Response data type
  • id. string, campaign id
  • name. string, campaign name
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to
  • status. string, campaign status
  • EmailsCountPerDay. integer, max number of emails a day sent
  • daysToFinishProspect. integer, number of days when the prospect finishes
  • daysFromLastProspectContact. integer
  • emailSendingDelaySeconds. integer, delay between sending emails in seconds
  • disableOpensTracking. boolean, disable email open tracking
  • repliesHandlingType. string/enum
  • enableLinksTracking. boolean, enable link open tracking
  • number. integer, step number
  • inMinutesCount. integer
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects

get.description:
GET api/v2/campaigns/:id/steps returns the list of existing campaign steps.

Response data type
  • id. integer
  • number. integer
  • inMinutesCount. integer
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects

post.description:
POST api/v2/campaigns/:id/steps/ adds a new step to an existing campaign.

Request Data type, campaign steps
  • number. integer, no maximum length, required (the numbers must be a sequence starting from 1, e.g. 1, 2, 3)
  • inMinutesCount. integer, no maximum length, required, must be greater than or equal to '0' for the first step, must be greater than '1' for the second and subsequent steps
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects, required.
Response data type
  • id. string, step id
  • name. string, campaign name
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to
  • status. string, campaign status
  • settings. object
  • EmailsCountPerDay. integer, max number of emails a day sent
  • daysToFinishProspect. integer, number of days when the prospect finishes
  • emailSendingDelaySeconds. integer, delay between sending emails in seconds
  • disableOpensTracking. boolean, disable email open tracking
  • repliesHandlingType. string/enum
  • enableLinksTracking. boolean, enable link open tracking
  • steps. array of steps
  • number. integer, step number
  • inMinutesCount. integer
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects

get.description:
GET api/v2/campaigns/:id/steps/:stepId returns a particular campaign step in an existing campaign.

Response data type
  • id. integer
  • number. integer
  • inMinutesCount. integer
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects

patch.description:
PATCH api/v2/campaigns/:id/steps/:stepid updates and existing step in an existing campaign.

Request data type
  • inMinutesCount. integer, required, must be greater than or equal to '0' for the first step, must be greater than '1' for the second and subsequent steps
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects, required.
Response data type
  • id. integer, step id
  • number. integer, step number
  • inMinutesCount. integer
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects

delete.description:
DELETE api/v2/campaigns/:id/steps/:stepId removes an existing step from an existing campaign.

You cannot remove a step if:
  1. The campaign was deleted or archived or there is no campaign with given Id.
  2. There is only one step in the campaign.
  3. At least one email was in campaign was already finished.

patch.description:
PATCH v2/campaigns/{id} updates an existing campaign by its ID.

Request data type
  • name. string, campaign name, required
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to, required
  • settings. list of campaign settings objects
  • EmailsCountPerDay. integer, max number of emails a day sent, required
  • daysToFinishProspect. integer, number of days when the prospect finishes, required
  • emailSendingDelaySeconds. integer, delay between sending emails in seconds, required
  • dailyThrottling. integer, number of prospects that will be processed by the sequence over the given 24-hour period, required
  • disableOpensTracking. boolean, disable email open tracking, required
  • repliesHandlingType. string/enum, maximum length 25 symbols, required. Possible values: Mark person as finished, Continue sending emails
  • enableLinksTracking. boolean, enable link open tracking, required
  • number. integer, step number, required
  • inMinutesCount. integer, must be greater than or equal to '0' for the first step, must be greater than '1' for the second and subsequent steps, required
Response data type
  • id. string, step id
  • name. string, campaign name
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to
  • status. string, campaign status
  • number. integer
  • settings. list of campaign settings objects
  • EmailsCountPerDay. integer, max number of emails a day sent
  • daysToFinishProspect. integer, number of days when the prospect finishes
  • daysFromLastProspectContact. integer, days since the last email to contact
  • emailSendingDelaySeconds. integer, delay between sending emails in seconds
  • disableOpensTracking. boolean, disable email open tracking
  • repliesHandlingType. string/enum
  • enableLinksTracking. boolean, enable link open tracking
  • steps. array of steps
  • id. integer, step id
  • number. integer, step number
  • inMinutesCount. integer
  • templates. list of Campaign Step Template objects

post.description:
POST v2/campaigns/{id}/start starts an existing campaign by its id.

Response data type
  • id. integer, campaign id
  • name. string, campaign name
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to
  • created. dateTime type, campaign creation date
  • status. string, campaign status
  • isArchived. boolean, whether campaign is archived

POST v2/campaigns/{id}/pause pauses a running campaign by its id.

Response data type
  • id. integer, campaign id
  • name. string, campaign name
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to
  • created. dateTime type, campaign creation date
  • status. string, campaign status
  • isArchived. boolean, whether campaign is archived

POST v2/campaigns/{id}/archive archives a running campaign by its id.

Response data type
  • id. integer, campaign id
  • name. string, campaign name
  • emailAccount. string, email account campaign belongs to
  • created. dateTime type, campaign creation date
  • status. string, campaign status
  • isArchived. boolean, whether campaign is archived

POST v2/campaigns/{sequenceId}//variants/toggle activates or pauses a email step variant in sequence.

  • "activate": "True" - activates email step variant
  • "activate": "False" - pauses email step variant Response data type
  • stepId. integer, sequence email step id
  • variantId. integer, sequence step variant id
  • isDisabled. boolean, is email step variant Enabled

get.description:
GET /people return list of all contacts in your Reply account.

Response data type
  • people. array, array of people
  • total. integer, total people count
  • page. integer, current page
  • limit. integer, page size. Default value is 100
  • pagesCount. integer, total number of pages with current limit
  • next. string, link for next page with current limit
  • previous. string, link to previous page with current limit

post.description:
POST /people adds contacts or updates if they already exist.

Mandatory fields to create a contact
  • email. string, contact's email, required
  • firstName. string, contact's first name, required
Note
You can add other standard and custom fields in the POST request when creating a contact.
Status code if contact was created
  • 201

delete.description:
DELETE /people/?id={{Your_ContactID}} deletes the contact by their id.

Status codes
  • 200 if deletion was successful.
  • 403 if a user does not have access to delete contacts.

get.description:
GET v1/people?email={{Your_ContactEmail}} returns status of a particular contact in campaign by their email.

Response data type
  • status. string, contact status in campaign

get.summary: Get List of Campaigns for Contact
get.description:
GET /people/{{contactId}}/sequences

return campaign(s) a contact belongs to Response data type
  • sequenceId. integer, sequence id
  • sequenceName. string, sequence name
  • status. string, sequence current status
  • isSequenceOwner. boolean, does sequence belongs to current user
Note
  • Sequence Owner flag result is based on the inserted API key per endpoint. When API key and Sequence belong to the same user, then Sequence Owner flag will be true. Otherwise, itll return as false.

GET /people/list/{{listId}} return list of all contacts by List Id from your Reply account People page

Response data type
  • people. array, array of people
  • total. integer, total people count
  • page. integer, current page
  • limit. integer, page size. Default value is 100
  • pagesCount. integer, total number of pages with current limit
  • next. string, link for next page with current limit
  • previous. string, link to previous page with current limit

GET /people/list/?name{{listName}} return list of all contacts by List Name from your Reply account People page

Response data type
  • people. array, array of people
  • total. integer, total people count
  • page. integer, current page
  • limit. integer, page size. Default value is 100
  • pagesCount. integer, total number of pages with current limit
  • next. string, link for next page with current limit
  • previous. string, link to previous page with current limit

post.description:
POST /actions/pushtocampaign pushes an existing contact to the selected campaign.

Request data type
  • campaignId. integer, required, id of the campaign you want push a contact
  • email. string, required, contact's email

post.summary: Create and Push Contact to Campaign
post.description:
POST /actions/addandpushtocampaign creates and pushes a contact to the selected campaign.

Request data type
  • campaignId. integer, required, id of the campaign you want push a contact
  • email. string, required, contact's email
  • firstName. string, required, contact's name

POST /actions/removepersonfromcampaignbyid removes an existing contact from the selected campaign.

Request data type
  • campaignId. integer, required, id of the campaign you want to remove a contact
  • email. string, required, contact's email

POST /actions/removepersonfromallcampaigns removes an existing contact from all campaigns.

Request data type
  • email. string, required, contact's email

POST /actions/markasreplied marks a contact as replied in all campaigns by their email address.

Request data type
  • email. string, required, contact's email

POST /actions/markasfinished marks a contact as finished in all campaigns by their email address.

Request data type
  • email. string, required, contact's email

post.summary: Unmark Contact as Out of Office
post.description:
POST /actions/unmark-as-out-of-office

unmarks a contact as Out Of Office by their email address. Request data type
  • email. string, required, contact's email
Response data type
  • contactCount. integer, number of contacts that were affected by current action

get.description:
GET v1/templates?id={{Your_TemplateID}} returns a template by its id. Response data type

  • id. template id, integer
  • name. template name, string
  • subject. template subject, string
  • body. template body, string
  • categoryId. template category, string

GET /stats/person?email={personEmail} returns the detailed contact's statistics, where personEmail is the contact's email address. Note The '@'-character should be escaped ('%40') because of the GET request security reasons. The inboxState field can hold one of the following values:

  • Interested
  • Not interested
  • Not now
  • Do not contact
  • Forwarded
Response data type
  • id. integer, contact's id
  • email. string, contact's email
  • fullName. string, contact's full name
  • isBlocked. boolean, whether contact is blacklisted
  • isOptedOut. boolean, whether contact has opted out
  • campaigns. array of campaigns the contact is participating
  • emails. array, info about emails within the given campaign

campaigns.name: Prospect Statistic Owner
campaigns.replyText: Sounds not so bad, can we arrange a meeting next week to discuss the details?

get.description:
GET /v1/Stats/GetPeopleSentPerCampaign?campaignId={id} returns the number of contacts that received at least one email in the specified campaign. Response data type

  • campaignId. integer, id of the specified campaign
  • ampaignName. string, campaign name
  • deliveredProspectsCount. integer, number of contacts that received at least one email

Statistics is displayed in real time for the current campaign step, so if it changes, the next APi request will return the updated statistics. Note
  • Removing a contact from a campaign does not change step statistics.
  • Adding a contact changes step statistics (if added contact has 1+ send email from campaign and etc.).
  • Deleting a contact from Reply changes step statistics.
  • The from and to parameters are optional (timestamp in UTC).
    • It is possible to specify a seven-day time interval only.
    • Data in response is filtered by sent emails (i.e. you'll see all related info about all sent emails within the specified time interval).
Errors - If step is deleted - 400 code - If campaign is deleted - 400 code - If campaign is archvied - 400 code Response data type
  • campaignId. integer, id of the specified campaign
  • ampaignName. string, campaign name
  • deliveredProspectsCount. integer, number of contacts that received at least one email
  • stepId. integer, id of the specified step
  • stepNumber. integer, number of the step in campaign
  • contactedPeople. integer, number of people contacted on the step
  • peopleSentTo. integer, number of people the email was sent on the current step
  • openedPeople. integer, number of people opened the email on the current step
  • repliedPeople. integer, number of replied contacts on the current step
  • bouncedPeople. integer, number of bounced contacts on the current step
  • clickedPeople. integer, number of contacts that opened a link
  • deliveryRate. integer, step delivery rate
  • openRate. integer, step open rate
  • replyRate. integer, step reply rate
  • interestedRate. integer, step interested rate
  • sentEmails. integer, number of emails sent on the current step
  • openedEmails. integer, number of emails opened on the current step
  • repliedEmails. integer, number of emails with replies detected on the current step
  • bouncedEmails. integer, integer, number of emails with bounces detected on the current step
  • clickedEmails. integer, integer, number of links opened on the current step

GET / blacklist?outputType=All or

GET / blacklist?outputType=0 returns the full list of blacklisted Domains and Emails. default

GET / blacklist requst will also return the full list of blacklisted Domains and Emails. Response data type

  • domains. array of blacklisted domains and emails

post.description: POST / blacklist?domain={domain} adds the specified domain to blacklist.

delete.description: DELETE / blacklist?domain={domain} removes the specified domain from blacklist.

get.description:
GET /emailAccounts returns the list of all email accounts in your Reply account.

Response data type
  • id. integer, email account id
  • senderName. string, email account sender name
  • emailAddress. string, email account email address
  • signature. string, email account signature

GET /SharedPageUrl returns the shared page URL for the current user.

Errors
  • 403 Forbidden. "message": "Shared page is not enabled for your account"

get.summary: Get a webhook subscription by Id
get.description:
GET /api/v2/webhooks/:id Returns a webhook subscription by id.

Response data type
  • id. integer, webhook id
  • event. string, event type name
  • url.string, registered url for triggering an event
  • isDisabled.boolean, if webhook is disabled
  • createdDate.DateTime when the webhook was created, UTC
  • includeEmailUrl.boolean, if webhook includes email url for later preview
  • includeProspectCustomFields.boolean, if webhook includes prospect custom fields

put.description:
PUT /api/v2/webhooks/:id Updates a webhook subscription.

The *Payload* section of the request body can be omitted. Status codes
  • 204 if update was successfull.
Request data type

GET /api/v2/webhooks returns all webhook subscriptions

Request data type
  • event. string, event type name
  • url. string, registered url for triggering on event
  • includeEmailUrl.boolean, if webhook includes email url for later preview
  • includeProspectCustomFields.boolean, if webhook includes prospect custom fields

delete.description:
DELETE /api/v2/webhooks/id Delete a webhook subscription. Status codes
  • 204 if deletion was successful.

get.description:
GET /api/v2/webhooks Returns the list of webhook subscriptions

Response data type Array of objects:
  • id. integer, webhook id
  • event.string, event type name
  • url.string, registered url for triggering an event
  • isDisabled.boolean, if webhook is disabled
  • createdDate.DateTime when the webhook was created, UTC
  • includeEmailUrl.boolean, if webhook includes email url for later preview
  • includeProspectCustomFields.boolean, if webhook includes prospect custom fields

post.description:
POST /api/v2/webhooks Adds a webhook subscription.

The *Payload* section of the request body can be omitted. In this case, the system will not include the email url and custom contact fields in the webhook payload. Status codes
  • 201 if creation was successful.
Request data type

GET /api/v2/webhooks returns all webhook subscriptions

Request data type
  • event.string, event type name
  • url.string, registered url for triggering an event
  • includeEmailUrl.boolean, if webhook includes email url for later preview
  • includeProspectCustomFields.boolean, if webhook includes prospect custom fields
Response data type
  • id. integer, id of the added webhook

get.summary: Get content of the email message
get.description:
GET /api/v2/emails/{message_id}/content Will return the subject of the message, html text and plain text

Response data type
  • subject string, message subject
  • htmlBody string, body of the message with html tags
  • textBody string, body of the message in plain text

get.summary: Get logs for the webhook subscription
get.description:
GET /api/v2/webhooks/id/logs Returns the list of logs for webhook subscriptions which returned not 200-299 HTTP status code

Response data type
  • eventId. guid, event id
  • httpStatus. integer, HTTP status returned by user api
  • date. datetime, date/time when error status was returned

communityTemplates.name: Introduction
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

My name is John and I am Business Developer Manager at Company Inc. I found your profile on LinkedIn, really liked what your company do and decided to reach out.

Quick question: Are you currently looking for the new ways to grow your SaaS product sales?

I might have something for you that potentially could become a new user aquisition channel for you, but that conversation can't begin until I listen to you first.
communityTemplates.subject: Intro

communityTemplates.name: Value proposition
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

Hoping to reach the person responsible for recruiting at {Company}. I'm reaching out because I manage partnerships at ABC Inc.

We help companies recruit best talents faster and easier, including IBM, Unbounce, Capterra, KissMetrics and Nike.

I'd love to hear more about your recruiting process. Do you have time for a quick call in the next few days?
communityTemplates.subject: Collaboration {Company} <-> ABC Inc

communityTemplates.name: Compliment
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

I really like the clean design and usability of your website. Its really, really good.

[Your brief value proposition] and would like to speak with someone who is responsible for this area at {Company}.

Are you the right person to speak about this? If not, who do you recommend I should contact?
communityTemplates.subject: Really like {Company} website design

communityTemplates.name: Looking for advice
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

Im a first time entrepreneur and I just started to build my product. Im looking for experts in this space and several of my friends pointed me in your direction. So I was hoping you could give me your feedback before I spent too much time building something that nobody wants.

Heres my idea: I have a crawler that crawls millions of websites daily and can see who started a free trial with Mixpanel almost instantly. Do you think information like that would be valuable for somebody like KISSmetrics or Im just wasting my time here?

Please let me know you will save me several years that Im going to spend building it otherwise :)
communityTemplates.subject: Looking for advice

communityTemplates.name: Future plans
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName}, 

My name is Alex and I am founder at GrowthHackers Inc. I found your startup on AngelList and really liked the idea.

Quick question: what are your future plans as for attracting new users?

I though I may have some ideas for you.

Thanks,
communityTemplates.subject: Growth hacking for {Company}

communityTemplates.name: Appropriate person
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName}, 

Im trying to figure out who is in charge of sales at your company. Would you mind pointing me towards the right person?

Thanks,
communityTemplates.subject: Looking for a sales contact

communityTemplates.name: Coffee via Paypal
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

Im writing an article on how outbound B2B sales is done in real world nowadays. I was looking for experts in this space and found your profile.

Is it any chance you can share your experience during brief 20 minutes call? In return Ill would love to send you a cup of coffee via paypal :)

Thanks,
communityTemplates.subject: Couple questions on outbound B2B sales

communityTemplates.name: Learn how
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

My name is Nick and Im a co-founder at {Your Company}. We help property managers optimize their pricing on marketplaces like HomeAway, VRBO, and Flipkey.

I wanted to learn how you currently handle price optimization and show you what were working on.

Are you available for a quick call tomorrow afternoon?
communityTemplates.subject: {Company} + {Your Company}

communityTemplates.name: Startup
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName},

I hope you don't mind me reaching out like this but as you know with startups "hustling" is the name of the game. :)

My name is Jake Smith. I'm the founder of Team HR. We're a candidate tracking system designed for teams, heavily inspired by Trello and Slack.

Essentially we help you advertise open positions, manage and organize candidates and streamline your team and candidate communication.

We have pricing for all budgets, including free. :) If you're interested just head to [link] to start your free trial.

Also, let me know if you'd like a demo or have any questions. And again, sorry for the unsolicited email. #startuplife

Jake
communityTemplates.subject: Quick question

communityTemplates.name: 10x
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

I have an idea that I can explain in 10 minutes that can get {Company} its next [100 best clients].

I recently used this idea to help our client {competitor} almost triple their monthly run rate.

{FirstName}, lets schedule a 10 minute call so I can explain. When works best for you?

Thanks,
communityTemplates.subject: 10x {company} traction in 10 minutes

communityTemplates.name: Dialogue
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

I know a little bit about your background and had some ideas in mind. However, I work differently, and if you are open to chatting Id like to begin with a dialogue instead of a pitch selling you a job. We might have a position to tell you about, but that conversation can't begin until we listen to you first and make sure we are on the same page.

I realize that my email may or may not have arrived at the right time. However, my goal is to connect with and understand an outstanding individual's professional frustrations/aspirations, and then align those needs with the startup that can best fit or help achieve that person's goals.

What's the best way for us to connect?
communityTemplates.subject: New career opportunity

communityTemplates.name: Colleague
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName},

I'm an engineer at Stripe. I came across your github profile, and really liked your ABC, XYZ projects. I wanted to see if you'd be interested in working with us at Stripe if you're up for it, I'd love to grab coffee next week to chat.

- gdb
communityTemplates.subject: Love your ABC, XYZ projects on github

communityTemplates.name: Top Management
communityTemplates.body:
Hi XX,

My name is Jason and I am CEO at ABC Inc. I found your profile on github while was looking for the top engineers with Ruby experience. I was impressed by your background and decided to drop a note.

You probably may not often see CEOs reaching out to potential candidates to discuss the career opportunity. But our company success so far is based on finding the best people and putting them together to work on fun, challenging and exiting projects. That is whyI focus a lot of my personal time on recruiting the greatest talents for our company.

We might have a position to tell you about, but that conversation can't begin until we listen to you first and make sure we are on the same page.

Please, let me know if you interested to learn more and I will connect you with someone from our team.
communityTemplates.subject: Looking for the best Ruby engineer to join ABC Inc

communityTemplates.name: New opportunity
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

Im Jason and I found your profile on LinkedIn while was looking for the best content marketers out there.

I saw that youre currently at {Company}, but wanted to reach out in case youre open to a new opportunity.

We are looking to hire a content marketing manager with a starting salary of [salary] with equity options. We just closed our series B of funding [link to announcement] and were looking to develop our content playbook as a channel for user acquisition. Our team would like to talk to you more and have you lead our content team to help us jump start those efforts.

Would you like to learn more?
communityTemplates.subject: New opportunity

communityTemplates.name: Learn about
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

My name is {FirstName} with {Your Company}.

We help {specific company type} with {one liner}.

I wanted to learn how you handle {thing your company handles} at {Company Name} and show our new approach. So far our customers reports 30% increase in {thing your company handles}

Are you available for a brief call at {time options}?
communityTemplates.subject: {Company Name} + {Your Company}

communityTemplates.name: Intro
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName},

My name is Oleg and I am Founder at Reply (http://replyapp.io) - outreach automation solution.

I just stumbled on your profile at [website name], really liked what your company do and decided to drop a quick note. And just in case if you may need solution we built or there is anything I can help\advise you with, feel free to reach out.

By the way: what are you heading with your marketing & sales right now?

Cheers,
communityTemplates.subject: Intro

communityTemplates.name: Trial sign up
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

My name is Oleg and I am a Founder at Reply. Today I was going throught our recent registration data and noticed that you signed up for the trial.

I am courious what made you sign up and how you think you can use Reply for growing your company sales?

You can just briefly reply to this email or let me know if you up to for a quick 5 minutes call to discuss.

Thanks
communityTemplates.subject: Thanks for signing up

communityTemplates.name: Demo request
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

Thank you for your inquiry and interest in Reply. My name is Lucy Literado and I'll be your account manager.

Please click on the following link to select a time for the demo that works well for you (and be sure to click the option to add it to your calendar as well):

https://calendly.com/lucy-

During the call I will be able to showcase the product, answer all of your questions and check if there is a fit.

Also, please let me know if you have any questions before the demo.
 
Thanks,
communityTemplates.subject: Reply Demo

communityTemplates.name: Trial follow up
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

Just wanted to check how is your trial going.

Did you have a chance to try out the solution or do you need any help with configuring your account?

Thanks,

communityTemplates.name: Right person
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

I hope Im not bothering you too much. Would you mind pointing me to the person in charge of sales development at {Company}?

Thanks for your time,

communityTemplates.name: Oneliner
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName} - any chance you could share your thoughts on [original request]. Any feedback is highly appreciated.

Thanks,

communityTemplates.name: Press coverage
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

Any chance this is something you would be interested in writing about? If so, please let me know and I will send you a press release.

Thanks,

communityTemplates.name: Quick follow up
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName},

Just a quick follow-up on a message I sent earlier: I would really appreciate to hear back from you.

Thanks,

communityTemplates.name: Feedback
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

I know you are super-busy and I hope I'm not bothering you too much.

Is there any chance you can quickly share your thoughts on [original request] or let me know if I'm just wasting our time here?

Thanks,

communityTemplates.name: Schedule time to talk
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName},

How is it going? Can we schedule a time to talk this week?

communityTemplates.name: Share updates
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName},

We've gotten some new press coverage [link]. Id love to pick up on our conversation. Whens a good time to chat?

communityTemplates.name: Quick call
communityTemplates.body:
Hey {FirstName},
Can hop on a quick call Wednesday 4pm or Thursday 11am?

Cheers,
Name

PS: thought you might find this article interesting [link]

communityTemplates.name: Circle back
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName}, 

I just wanted to circle back on the email I sent last week on [your value proposition].

Let me know what makes sense as a next step, if any?

Thanks,

communityTemplates.name: Invite to chat
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName},

I sent you an email last week to see if you any need help with automating your cold emailing routine.
If you do, I would love to chat with you. 

Let me know!

Cheers,
communityTemplates.subject: Automating cold outreach

communityTemplates.name: Any interest?
communityTemplates.body:
{FirstName},

Is the below of any interest to you?

communityTemplates.name: Break up
communityTemplates.body:
Hi {FirstName}, 

I was really looking forward to putting together a trunk of great clothes for you, but I havent heard a response to my calls and emails.
That means this will be my last email to you. If you change your mind and would like to give ABC a try, please let me know and Ill have you looking great in no time.

Best wishes,
communityTemplates.subject: Goodbye from ABC Inc.

example.name: Introduction
example.body:
Hi {FirstName},

My name is John and I am Business Developer Manager at Company Inc. I found your profile on LinkedIn, really liked what your company do and decided to reach out.

Quick question: Are you currently looking for the new ways to grow your SaaS product sales?

I might have something for you that potentially could become a new user aquisition channel for you, but that conversation can't begin until I listen to you first.
example.subject: Intro

campaigns.name: Prospect Statistic Owner
campaigns.replyText: Sounds not so bad, can we arrange a meeting next week to discuss the details?

example.name: Prospect Statistic Owner
example.replyText: Sounds not so bad, can we arrange a meeting next week to discuss the details?

tags.name: Webhook subscriptions
tags.description:
This set of web API endpoints allows you to manage webhooks through web API calls. Limits: The number of webhooks limited to 3 active subscriptions per webhook. Types of webhook events
  • email_replied
  • reply_categorized
  • email_sent
  • email_opened
  • contact_opted_out
  • contact_finished
  • contact_called
